articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Europe will invest more in security and lead on providing guarantees to Kyiv, but cooperation with Washington to secure peace remains crucial, European leaders said after an emergency meeting held ahead of U.S.-Russia talks on Ukraine.
articles.title: Europe says it is committed to Ukraine ahead of Russia-US talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel will begin negotiations on the second phase of the Gaza ceasefire deal, including an exchange of the remaining Israeli hostages with Palestinian detainees, Foreign Minister Gideon Saar said on Tuesday, adding that Israel demanded a complete demilitarisation of the enclave.
articles.title: Israel to begin negotiations on second phase of Gaza ceasefire deal, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Burundi is withdrawing its forces from eastern Congo where they had been fighting against M23 rebels, four sources said on Tuesday, in a further blow to the Democratic Republic of Congo army as it struggles to halt a rebel advance.
articles.title: Burundi troops withdraw from M23 fight in new blow to Congo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Delta Air Lines said on Tuesday that 19 out of the 21 passengers transported to local hospitals after a Toronto plane crash a day earlier have been released, as officials continue a probe into why the regional jet flipped over upon landing.
articles.title: After Toronto plane crash, Delta says 19 out of 21 passengers released from hospitals

articles.author: Sabine Siebold
articles.description: Faced with U.S. demands to provide the military muscle to enforce a future Ukraine peace deal, Europe finds itself in a bind.
articles.title: European forces would struggle to guarantee Ukraine peace without US backing

articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians living in refugee camps in the occupied West Bank have left their homes as a weeks-long Israeli offensive has demolished houses and torn up vital infrastructure in the heavily built up townships, Palestinian authorities said.
articles.title: Tens of thousands of Palestinians flee West Bank refugee camps

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A U.S. judge dismissed a lawsuit against the CIA by journalists and lawyers who said the intelligence agency illegally spied on them when they visited Wikileaks founder Julian Assange while he was holed up at Ecuador's embassy in London.
articles.title: Assange visitors' lawsuit against CIA dismissed by US judge

articles.author: Sonia Rolley
articles.description: Government forces and local militias have clashed south of the provincial capital of Bukavu in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo as troops fall back in the face of an advance by Rwanda-backed M23 rebels, military sources and townsfolk say.
articles.title: Congo army retreat from Bukavu leads to clashes with allied militias

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: China supports all efforts conducive to peace talks in Ukraine, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi told the United Nations Security Council on Tuesday, and stressed that Gaza and the West Bank are "not a bargaining chip in political trade-offs."
articles.title: China supports all Ukraine peace efforts, Gaza is not a 'bargaining chip', says Wang

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea's foreign ministry said on Tuesday that it will keep bolstering its nuclear force, denouncing a recent joint pledge by the United States, South Korea and Japan for its denuclearisation, according to state media KCNA.
articles.title: North Korea denounces 'absurd' denuclearisation pledge by US and allies
